content: The pilot was kind of boring. Fornell was against NCIS, Abby didn't show up. At first I thought Gibbs and Kate would end up dating. I started to like Tony already I began to watch this show starting watching it in the summer. It was a good episode
The episode is great Kate becomes an NCIS agent, they investigate a marine's death. Gibbs was heartwarming to the kid that what makes him great.
The episode I watched it and I was like. "This might be the greatest show I had ever seen" I liked it when Kate was standing up to Tony.

Man this episode was so cool they go on a navy ship and investigate it.
The NCIS team get to see McGee the first ever time. McGee had a crush on Abby and was nervous about it, he didn't know about the things in NCIS until Tony shows him.

I got to say I love the drawings when Kate drew the team including Tony's womenizer personality. There was some funny moments

A very poor episode. You expect the odd lemon in any long running series but to start the new season with such a lemon doesn't bode well. The first third spent on Gibbs having his 'flashbacks', which with the odd rare exception leave me wondering why they ever bother except perhaps for an easy way to fill a few minutes of broadcast time, interspersed with a clown in the operating theatre. The second third was mostly welcome back Gibbs and some filler with all the actual story and action left to the last third but if everything could be fixed that easy, why did they fail so spectacularly in earlier episodes. Even allowing suspension of disbelief for the sake of the story, does not compute. It seemed as if the writers just had no idea what to do with this episode. I really hope the quality of this episode was an aberration and not a forewarning of what is to come in the rest of the season. But if it is then this is the episode where the Series jumped the shark, and yes, it was that bad.
Awesome,but starting to think Mark Harmon is setting up to leave the show..
Better than the first episode of the season, then again it would be hard to be worse, but still only just above average.
This episode was a bit slower then season started with,but so love how this cast works together,they really make the show..
Cool episode,like how Jethro took director Vance on the job with him & treated him as a probie,that was funny.

I call bull on these writers having them arrest all these evil people so they can make a deal with some worthless higher up pencil pusher to roll over on some other scumbag or they just somehow escape, and kill even more people. We all know in real life the agents wouldn't waste the courts time or the tax payers money, they would just put a bullet in their brain-pan. I know that's what I would do, and end the demon's reign once and for all. Their victims don't get to live, why should they? We want to see the bad guys get smoked, not get room and board for the rest of their lives.

I can't believe Ellie knows and Gibbs doesn't?  Forget the fact that she's secretly alive, the fact that Gibbs has no idea...so we are led to believe...is what boggles my mind.  Excellent episode, and that little girl, Sunnie Pelant should go far...she's an amazing young actress.

agree 100
I

I leave very few comments on any episode of any series. It has to have hit me like a ton of bricks & yes this one has floored me and should have been an ultimately extended blockbuster movie released in major cinemas. This episode, who ever imagined & penned this work of art, then of course the direction,  production & talented cast members is w/o any doubt proof that this whole series hasn't lost one bit of its extraordinary talented staff behind its legacy  16 years of a phenomenal television series that has deserved its high ratings every single year. To come up with an episode so wonderfully written, filmed & acted so late in the series game is fantastic. In my book this series should run its total course, what ya say, another 16 years?
Wow.  Always something new to learn about Gibbs...another one of many reasons why this show will NEVER get old!

This special episode (A Thousand Yards) is the 1,000th original episode of the NCIS franchise, which includes NCIS, NCIS: Los Angeles, NCIS: New Orleans, NCIS: Hawai'i, and NCIS: Sydney combined. It is also the 464th episode of the flagship series, NCIS.
